storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to input manual attendance entries to achieve complete attendance records

testCases.title: Validate manual attendance creation with valid data
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
Manual attendance entry page is accessible
At least one employee exists in the system
No existing attendance record exists for the selected employee and date

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance entry page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with required fields including employee selector, date picker, time in, time out, and attendance status fields

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and displayed in the form

steps.action: Select a valid date using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated in the date field

steps.action: Enter valid time in (e.g., 09:00 AM) and time out (e.g., 05:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Time values are accepted and displayed in the respective fields without validation errors

steps.action: Select attendance status (e.g., Present, Half-day)
steps.expectedResult: Attendance status is selected and displayed

steps.action: Add optional remarks or notes in the remarks field
steps.expectedResult: Remarks are entered successfully

steps.action: Click the Submit button to save the manual attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: Entry is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed showing 'Manual attendance entry created successfully', and the form is cleared or redirected to the attendance list

steps.action: Verify the submission response time
steps.expectedResult: System responds and saves the entry within 3 seconds

postconditions: Manual attendance entry is saved in the database
Audit log contains entry creation record with HR officer username and timestamp
Employee attendance record is updated for the specified date
Confirmation message is visible to the user

testCases.title: Verify validation prevents overlapping attendance records
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
Manual attendance entry page is accessible
An existing attendance record exists for employee 'John Doe' on date '2024-01-15' with time 09:00 AM to 05:00 PM

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance entry page
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance form is displayed

steps.action: Select employee 'John Doe' from the employee dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Employee 'John Doe' is selected

steps.action: Select date '2024-01-15' which already has an attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated in the date field

steps.action: Enter overlapping time in as 10:00 AM and time out as 06:00 PM
steps.expectedResult: Time values are entered in the form

steps.action: Click Submit button to attempt creating the overlapping attendance record
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'Attendance record already exists for this employee on the selected date' or 'Overlapping attendance period detected' and blocks submission

steps.action: Change the date to '2024-01-16' which has no existing attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Date field is updated to '2024-01-16'

steps.action: Keep the same time in (10:00 AM) and time out (06:00 PM) values
steps.expectedResult: Time values remain in the form

steps.action: Click Submit button to resubmit with corrected non-overlapping data
steps.expectedResult: Submission succeeds, confirmation message 'Manual attendance entry created successfully' is displayed, and entry is saved

postconditions: No overlapping attendance record is created
Valid attendance entry for the corrected date is saved in the database
Audit log records the successful entry creation
Original attendance record for 2024-01-15 remains unchanged

testCases.title: Ensure audit trail logs manual attendance changes
preconditions: User is logged in as authorized HR officer with username 'hr.officer@company.com'
Manual attendance entry page is accessible
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
Database has audit trail table configured
At least one employee exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance entry page
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance form is displayed

steps.action: Select employee 'Jane Smith', date '2024-01-20', time in '08:30 AM', time out '04:30 PM', and status 'Present'
steps.expectedResult: All fields are populated with the entered values

steps.action: Click Submit button to create the manual attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: Entry is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Access the audit log table or audit trail report for manual attendance
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays a new record with action 'CREATE', user 'hr.officer@company.com', timestamp of creation, employee 'Jane Smith', date '2024-01-20', and all entered attendance details

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance records list and locate the created entry for Jane Smith on 2024-01-20
steps.expectedResult: Attendance record is displayed in the list

steps.action: Click Edit button on the attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with existing attendance data pre-populated

steps.action: Modify the time out from '04:30 PM' to '05:00 PM' and add remarks 'Extended work hours'
steps.expectedResult: Modified values are entered in the form

steps.action: Click Update button to save the modifications
steps.expectedResult: Entry is updated successfully and confirmation message 'Attendance record updated successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Access the audit log table or audit trail report again
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays a new record with action 'UPDATE', user 'hr.officer@company.com', timestamp of modification, employee 'Jane Smith', date '2024-01-20', old value 'time out: 04:30 PM', new value 'time out: 05:00 PM', and remarks modification details

steps.action: Navigate back to the attendance records list and locate the entry for Jane Smith on 2024-01-20
steps.expectedResult: Attendance record is displayed

steps.action: Click Delete button on the attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this attendance record?'

steps.action: Click Confirm or Yes to proceed with deletion
steps.expectedResult: Entry is deleted successfully and confirmation message 'Attendance record deleted successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Access the audit log table or audit trail report once more
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays a new record with action 'DELETE', user 'hr.officer@company.com', timestamp of deletion, employee 'Jane Smith', date '2024-01-20', and all details of the deleted record

steps.action: Verify that all three audit log entries (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE) are present and contain complete information
steps.expectedResult: All audit log entries are present with 100% completeness including user, timestamp, action type, and affected data

postconditions: Audit log contains three entries for the attendance record: CREATE, UPDATE, and DELETE
Each audit entry includes HR officer username, accurate timestamp, action type, and complete data details
Audit trail completeness is 100% for all manual attendance modifications
Deleted attendance record is no longer visible in the active records list but is preserved in audit history

storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to bulk upload manual attendance records to achieve efficient data entry

testCases.title: Validate successful bulk upload with valid CSV
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
Bulk upload page is accessible
Valid CSV file is prepared with correct schema (columns: employee_id, date, time_in, time_out, status, remarks)
CSV file contains 50 valid attendance records
All employees referenced in CSV exist in the system
No overlapping attendance records exist for the dates in the CSV

steps.action: Navigate to the bulk upload page from the main attendance menu
steps.expectedResult: Bulk upload page is displayed with file upload form, instructions for CSV format, and a sample CSV download link

steps.action: Review the CSV format instructions and required columns
steps.expectedResult: Instructions clearly state required columns: employee_id, date, time_in, time_out, status, remarks

steps.action: Click 'Choose File' or 'Browse' button to open file selector
steps.expectedResult: File selection dialog opens

steps.action: Select the valid CSV file containing 50 attendance records
steps.expectedResult: Selected file name is displayed next to the file input field

steps.action: Click 'Upload' or 'Submit' button to initiate the bulk upload process
steps.expectedResult: System displays a progress indicator showing 'Processing file...' or upload progress percentage

steps.action: Wait for the system to process the CSV file
steps.expectedResult: System completes processing within 2 minutes and displays upload summary report

steps.action: Review the upload summary report displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Summary shows: Total records: 50, Successfully uploaded: 50, Failed: 0, Processing time, and a success message 'All records uploaded successfully'

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance records list or search for specific records from the uploaded CSV
steps.expectedResult: All 50 attendance records from the CSV are visible in the system

steps.action: Verify a sample of 5 records by comparing CSV data with saved records in the system
steps.expectedResult: All verified records match the CSV data exactly including employee_id, date, time_in, time_out, status, and remarks

steps.action: Check the database or audit log for bulk upload entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows bulk upload event with HR officer username, timestamp, file name, and number of records processed

postconditions: All 50 valid attendance records are persisted in the database
Upload summary report is available for download or viewing
Audit log contains bulk upload event details
No duplicate or overlapping records are created
System performance meets the 2-minute processing requirement for 50 records

testCases.title: Verify error reporting for invalid CSV records
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
Bulk upload page is accessible
CSV file is prepared with 20 records: 15 valid records and 5 invalid records
Invalid records include: missing employee_id, invalid date format, time_out before time_in, non-existent employee_id, and missing required status field

steps.action: Navigate to the bulk upload page
steps.expectedResult: Bulk upload form is displayed with file upload option

steps.action: Click 'Choose File' button and select the CSV file containing 15 valid and 5 invalid records
steps.expectedResult: File name is displayed in the file input field

steps.action: Click 'Upload' button to submit the CSV file
steps.expectedResult: System begins processing the file and displays progress indicator

steps.action: Wait for the system to complete validation and processing
steps.expectedResult: System completes processing and displays upload summary with error details

steps.action: Review the upload summary report
steps.expectedResult: Summary shows: Total records: 20, Successfully uploaded: 15, Failed: 5, with a warning message 'Some records failed validation'

steps.action: Expand or view the detailed error report section
steps.expectedResult: Detailed error messages are displayed for each of the 5 invalid records including: Row 3 - 'Missing employee_id', Row 7 - 'Invalid date format, expected YYYY-MM-DD', Row 11 - 'Time out cannot be before time in', Row 14 - 'Employee ID EMP999 does not exist', Row 18 - 'Missing required field: status'

steps.action: Download or export the error report if option is available
steps.expectedResult: Error report is downloaded as CSV or PDF file containing all error details with row numbers and error descriptions

steps.action: Verify that valid records were saved by navigating to attendance records list
steps.expectedResult: 15 valid attendance records from the CSV are visible and saved in the system

steps.action: Open the original CSV file and correct the 5 invalid records based on error messages
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is corrected with valid employee_id, proper date format (YYYY-MM-DD), correct time sequence, existing employee_id, and required status field

steps.action: Return to bulk upload page and upload the corrected CSV file
steps.expectedResult: File upload form is displayed

steps.action: Select the corrected CSV file and click Upload button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the file

steps.action: Review the upload summary for the corrected file
steps.expectedResult: Summary shows: Total records: 5, Successfully uploaded: 5, Failed: 0, with success message 'All records uploaded successfully'

steps.action: Verify the 5 corrected records are now saved in the system
steps.expectedResult: All 5 previously failed records are now visible in the attendance records list with correct data

postconditions: 15 valid records from initial upload are saved in the database
5 invalid records from initial upload are rejected and not saved
Detailed error report is available showing specific validation errors for each failed record
5 corrected records from second upload are saved in the database
Total of 20 attendance records are now in the system
Audit log contains both upload attempts with success and failure counts

testCases.title: Ensure access control for bulk upload functionality
preconditions: Two user accounts exist: one unauthorized user (role: Employee) with username 'employee@company.com' and one authorized HR officer (role: HR Officer) with username 'hr.officer@company.com'
Bulk upload functionality is restricted to HR Officer role only
Role-based access control is configured and active
Both users have valid login credentials

steps.action: Open the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter username 'employee@company.com' and corresponding password for the unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are entered in the login form

steps.action: Click Login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the employee dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the bulk upload page by entering the URL directly (e.g., /attendance/bulk-upload) or through menu navigation
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access this page' or 'Unauthorized access' and user is redirected to dashboard or error page

steps.action: Verify that bulk upload menu option is not visible in the navigation menu for the employee user
steps.expectedResult: Bulk upload option is not displayed in the attendance menu or navigation

steps.action: Log out from the employee account
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out successfully and redirected to login page

steps.action: Enter username 'hr.officer@company.com' and corresponding password for the authorized HR officer
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are entered in the login form

steps.action: Click Login button
steps.expectedResult: HR officer is successfully logged in and redirected to the HR dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance menu or main navigation
steps.expectedResult: Bulk upload option is visible in the attendance menu for HR officer

steps.action: Click on the bulk upload menu option or navigate to /attendance/bulk-upload
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and bulk upload page is displayed with file upload form and instructions

steps.action: Verify all bulk upload functionality is available including file selection, upload button, and format instructions
steps.expectedResult: All bulk upload features are accessible and functional for the HR officer

steps.action: Check audit log for access attempts
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows denied access attempt by 'employee@company.com' and successful access by 'hr.officer@company.com' with timestamps

postconditions: Unauthorized employee user cannot access bulk upload functionality
Authorized HR officer has full access to bulk upload page and features
Role-based access control is enforced correctly
Access attempts are logged in audit trail
No security breach or unauthorized data modification occurred

storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to audit manual attendance changes to achieve compliance and traceability

testCases.title: Verify audit log creation for manual attendance changes
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Officer with audit log access permissions
Manual attendance module is accessible and functional
Audit log database is operational and configured
At least one employee record exists in the system
Test data for manual attendance entries is prepared

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance entry module
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry page loads successfully

steps.action: Create a new manual attendance entry for an employee with date, time-in, and time-out details
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is created successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log module via the menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully showing recent audit entries

steps.action: Search for the recently created manual attendance entry in the audit log by filtering with current date and 'CREATE' action type
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the CREATE action with correct user identity, timestamp, employee details, and attendance data

steps.action: Return to manual attendance module and update the previously created attendance entry by modifying the time-out value
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate back to the audit log module and filter by current date and 'UPDATE' action type
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the UPDATE action with user identity, timestamp, old values, and new values for the modified fields

steps.action: Return to manual attendance module and delete the previously created attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is deleted successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate back to the audit log module and filter by current date and 'DELETE' action type
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the DELETE action with user identity, timestamp, and details of the deleted attendance record

steps.action: Apply multiple filters in the audit log: select specific user, date range (today), and all action types (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE)
steps.expectedResult: System returns all three audit records (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE) matching the filter criteria with accurate details and within 5 seconds

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button in the audit log interface and select CSV format
steps.expectedResult: CSV file download initiates successfully

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: CSV file contains all filtered audit records with columns for action type, user, timestamp, employee details, old values, new values, and is properly formatted

postconditions: All manual attendance actions (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE) are logged in the audit database
Audit logs contain complete and accurate information including user identity and timestamps
Exported CSV file is saved in the downloads folder
Test attendance entry is deleted from the system
Audit logs remain immutable and intact

testCases.title: Ensure audit log access control
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Test user accounts exist: one unauthorized user (e.g., regular employee) and one authorized HR officer
Audit log module is deployed and accessible
Authentication system is functional
Manual attendance audit logs contain data

steps.action: Open the application login page in a browser
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter credentials for an unauthorized user (regular employee without HR or auditor role) and click Login
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to their dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the audit log module by entering the audit log URL directly or searching for it in the menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with an error message stating 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view audit logs' or the audit log option is not visible in the menu

steps.action: Attempt to access the audit log API endpoint directly (GET /api/manual-attendance/audit-logs) using browser or API testing tool
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Enter credentials for an authorized HR officer with audit log access permissions and click Login
steps.expectedResult: HR officer is successfully authenticated and redirected to their dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log module via the menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Audit log module is accessible and loads successfully, displaying the audit log interface with search and filter options

steps.action: Verify that audit log records are visible and can be filtered by date, user, and action type
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are displayed correctly with all filtering options functional and records are retrievable

steps.action: Access the audit log API endpoint directly (GET /api/manual-attendance/audit-logs) using the authorized session
steps.expectedResult: API returns 200 OK status code with audit log data in JSON format

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains unable to access audit logs
Authorized HR officer has full access to audit log functionality
Access control rules are enforced at both UI and API levels
All access attempts are logged in the system security logs
User sessions are properly managed and terminated after logout
